settings.text: Your test result: Unfortunately, we do not recommend IPL for you
settings.text1: The Best Device for Your Skin & Hair Type
settings.text2: We do not recommend IPL for your hair type or skin tone
settings.text4: Based on your responses, your hair color likely contains very low levels of melanin (common in light blonde, red, or gray hair), or your skin tone contains high levels of melanin. IPL technology works by targeting the melanin in hair follicles to disrupt hair growth, so it may not be effective for your hair type. On darker skin tones, IPL can cause irritation or discoloration.
settings.text5: We want to ensure you get the best results possible — and that means offering honest guidance, even when that means holding off on a recommendation.
settings.text7: Your safety is our top priority. You answered that you're currently pregnant or breastfeeding. For precautionary reasons, we don’t recommend using IPL devices during this period. Thank you for your trust and understanding.
settings.text8: Feel free to save this page — we’ll be here when you’re ready.

settings.text: Your test result: We do not recommend IPL hair removal products for users under 18 years of age.
settings.text1: The Best Device for Your Skin & Hair Type
settings.text2: We do not recommend IPL hair removal products for you
settings.text4: We don't recommend individuals under the age of 18 use any of our IPL hair removal devices. The body undergoes a number of hormonal changes during adolescence, so treatments may be less effective at this time. There is no maximum age for adults who want to use the Ulike IPL, but treatments tend to have less of an effect on grey hairs.
settings.text5: We want to ensure you get the best results possible — and that means offering honest guidance, even when that means holding off on a recommendation.

settings.title: Who wouldn't recommend this product?
settings.cont: Ulike IPL hair removal device is not recommended if you have any of the following:-A known skin disorder-Skin diseases such as allergic dermatitis, eczema, etc.-Photosensitive epilepsy or Photosensitivity-Menstruating, pregnant, or lactating-Dark black or sunburnt skin (please refer to color guide)-Damaged skin, a scab or healed wound, cancer or hemangioma-Any artificial aesthetic, prosthetic, or plastic area-Tattoos on the area for treatment

settings.title: Can I use it during period?
settings.cont: As per our recommendation, we do not advise women to use IPL during their menstrual cycle. This is because, during this time, women's skin is more sensitive and prone to irritation. We suggest starting IPL after the menstrual cycle ends to achieve the best results and comfort. If you have any further questions or require assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us. Thank you!

settings.title: How long do I have to wait to use Ulike if I have been takin
settings.cont: If you have recently taken medication, please wait at least one week after finishing the course before using the Ulike device. If you are taking medication on a long-term basis, it is not recommended to use IPL. Please consult with your healthcare provider for further guidance.

settings.title: Can IPL suitable for me if I have mild folliculitis?
settings.cont: If you have mild folliculitis, you can still use IPL for hair removal. However, it is important to moisturize your skin before using the device. You can apply a moisturizing cream a few days before the hair removal to make sure your skin is hydrated enough. This will help prevent any irritation or damage to the skin. It is always best to consult with a professional to ensure that IPL is the right treatment option for your specific condition.

settings.title: Does Ulike IPL work for acne and acne scarring?
settings.cont: Thank you for your interest in Ulike IPL. While Ulike IPL is primarily designed for hair removal, it can potentially offer some benefits for certain skin concerns, including acne but not acne scarring.IPL technology has been found to have positive effects on the skin, such as stimulating collagen production and improving overall skin texture. This can contribute to reducing the appearance of acne scars over time. Additionally, IPL may help to target and reduce active acne by targeting the bacteria and inflammation associated with breakouts.

settings.title: Can I use the Ulike Epilator on my nipples/areolas?
settings.cont: No, it is not recommended to use the Ulike Epilator on the nipples or areolas. The skin in these areas is sensitive and delicate, and using an epilator may cause discomfort, irritation, or potential injury. It is important to handle such areas with care and consider alternative hair removal methods specifically designed for sensitive areas, such as using small scissors, tweezing, or consulting with a professional for specialized treatments. Prioritizing safety and being gentle with delicate areas is crucial to avoid any adverse reactions.

settings.title: Can Ulike IPL cause cancer?
settings.cont: IPL is a popular, well-researched option for safe and effective long-term hair removal. Our IPL handsets are FDA-cleared for safe at-home use. They are also certified by FCC, CE, & RoHS. Ulike IPL hair removal does not cause cancer or other long-term complications caused by UV exposure. All UV rays are filtered to protect your skin.
